intro: Phaca piscina, commonly known as the water scum plant, is a small aquatic plant found in freshwater environments. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is characterized by its filamentous growth habit. The plant typically forms dense mats on the surface of ponds and slow-moving streams. It has tiny, scale-like leaves that are often difficult to see without magnification. Phaca piscina plays a role in water ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and invertebrates.
